org.hs.jfc
Class CursorCenter

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.util.AbstractMap
        |
        +--java.util.TreeMap
              |
              +--org.hs.jfc.CursorCenter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, Map, Serializable, SortedMap
public class CursorCenter
extends TreeMap

The CursorCenter creates a cache of colorizable java.awt.Cursor templates. Cursors are cached by Descriptor, and may be retrieved with or without a special background color.

See Also:
CursorCenter.Descriptor, Serialized Form

Nested Class Summary
static class CursorCenter.Descriptor
          Describes a colorizable java.awt.Cursor with its image file (which must be in standard .gif format: funny compressions don't work), the color of the transparent regions, and the color of the colorizable regions.
 
Constructor Summary
CursorCenter()
          Create an empty CursorCenter
 
Method Summary
 Cursor getCursor(CursorCenter.Descriptor descriptor)
          Create, cache and return the cursor specified by descriptor, or retrieve it from the cache if it has been previously requested by a get method.
 Cursor getCursor(CursorCenter.Descriptor descriptor, Color color)
          Create and cache the cursor specified by descriptor, or obtain it from the cache if it has already been created; and substitute all pixels of the chameleonColor provided by descriptor with color; then return the colorized cursor.

Constructor Detail

CursorCenter

public CursorCenter()
Create an empty CursorCenter

Method Detail

getCursor

public Cursor getCursor(CursorCenter.Descriptor descriptor)
Create, cache and return the cursor specified by descriptor, or retrieve it from the cache if it has been previously requested by a get method.

getCursor

public Cursor getCursor(CursorCenter.Descriptor descriptor,
                        Color color)
Create and cache the cursor specified by descriptor, or obtain it from the cache if it has already been created; and substitute all pixels of the chameleonColor provided by descriptor with color; then return the colorized cursor. Does not cache the colorization (which is a trivial process).
